channel.title: Speed or looks?
channel.description:
I'm just wondering what other peoples opinions are, what would you rather have a car that looks good, or a car that can go fast?
Personally i think i would rather have a car that looks good which isn't as fast as the other then one which doesn't look good at all but can go fast.

item.title: Speed or looks?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

I’d go for a reliable car, dont care much about looks/performance.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ak226688 wrote:

fast and looks good

id go for looks

Read full topic

item.title: Speed or looks?
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:4, topic:266842”]Performance > Looks

Ofcourse there are exceptions:

It might perform amazingly well but I wouldn’t go near it with a barge pole. It’s one ugly beast.

I think a compromise between the two, pointing towards better performance preferably.[/quote]

My mate owns a tuning company in a place called Burnley… He had his gumpert on Top Gear

Hes sold it now and at the minute he’s driving a 480bhp AUDI Rs4 while he decides wheter to get a ferrari or a lambo

Read full topic

item.title: Speed or looks?
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:15, topic:266842”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=352341.msg2704090#msg2704090 date=1236858585]
Or maybe if you just like driving fast???
[/quote]
Driving Fast isnt as easy as it use to be. There are some places like Track days where this is possible but in most cases you have to be very rich and own your track to drive fast.[/quote]
autobahn

Read full topic

item.title: Speed or looks?
item.dc:creator: @Ford_2_Race Ford 2 Race
item.description:
@Ford_2_Race wrote:

To be honest, I mostly go for looks for a change.

item.title: Speed or looks?
item.dc:creator: @A_Legend A Legend
item.description:
@A_Legend wrote:

Driving Fast isnt as easy as it use to be. There are some places like Track days where this is possible but in most cases you have to be very rich and own your track to drive fast.

I agree with what you are saying, allot of the new laws brought in restrict you from allot of speed, if you actually do go fast you’ll be pulled over or have a speeding ticket so either way you’ll get caught, but still there is private places you can go where there isn’t cameras or much traffic where you can still see how fast you can get out of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Speed or looks?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Fat Cookies:

If you want a 40 year old Virgin that has no life at all and watches Top/Fifth Gear on Dave and looks at 17 year olds of /b/ all day you get a really fast car.

Or maybe if you just like driving fast???

item.title: Speed or looks?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

If you want to impress a lady you get a good looking car that has Italian leather wraped round Seat warmers and you will be sucessfull.
If you want a 40 year old Virgin that has no life at all and watches Top/Fifth Gear on Dave and looks at 17 year olds of /b/ all day you get a really fast car.

There are a few expections, like some Ferrari’s, Lamborghini’s and Astin Martins.
Cars that are Beautiful and suprisingly fast are the best like the Alfa Romeo 8C.

Read full topic

item.title: Speed or looks?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Although, speed and looks aren’t everything; I’ll stick to the question. Well, it has to be somewhere in the middle… You don’t want a kick-ass looking car that goes 30; and at the same time you don’t want a flying hunk of shit that goes 300+Kph.

Read full topic

item.title: Speed or looks?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Performance > Looks

Ofcourse there are exceptions:

It might perform amazingly well but I wouldn’t go near it with a barge pole. It’s one ugly beast.

I think a compromise between the two, pointing towards better performance preferably.

Read full topic

item.title: Speed or looks?
item.dc:creator: @Waffendennis Waffendennis
item.description:
@Waffendennis wrote:

Same here, I like the ‘sleeper look’. The sleeper look is when a car looks not fast but when you give it hell everyone will be surprised by what just happened.

For example my track car, when I was building it and testing it on the road it was all OEM looking, but it already had a build N/A K20A in it and was build to 260BHP. I had some people that tried to race me, and they were like WTF?!

Read full topic

item.title: Speed or looks?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

performance wins over looks for me. But if you get a car that is just amazing to look at then im not sure. Overall i would take the faster car over a better looking one but if a car has performance and looks then the better. Or if its the best compromise

Read full topic
